Dialogue: White folks always be on stuff like decades too late and act like they discovered some shit.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: "Oofta" is the jazz age term for Bojangle types who Blacked it up for White audiences.

Speaker: mitch
Dialogue: Don't sleep on T-Bone man.

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: Rock, Jazz, Blues - Nigga whatchu got on right now?

Speaker: mitch
Dialogue: Public Enemy my Nig--

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: --Yo watch that man.

Speaker: gordon
Dialogue: You just called him --

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: -- Ya'll get Country Clubs we get to say Nigga.

Speaker: gordon
Dialogue: And golf? And all our girls?

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: Whatchu mean all your girls?

Speaker: gordon
Dialogue: Dude, between OJ, Tiger, Wesley Snipes and uh, Troy over here...

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: Yo. It's a word for that. Reparations.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: An Oofta modulates his Blackness up or down depending on the crowd and what he wants from them.

Speaker: mitch
Dialogue: Kurt?

Speaker: kurt
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: gordon
Dialogue: Kurt.

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: That's the magazine right?

Speaker: gordon
Dialogue: For starters.

Speaker: mitch
Dialogue: What other "magazine" you know has a first look deal at NBC? The third biggest Youtube channel. Talk show. Platinum comedy record homie!

Speaker: gordon
Dialogue: Couldn't you see him on the talk show Kurt?

Speaker: kurt
Dialogue: I fold.

Speaker: sungmi
Dialogue: Okay, and a nose-job is a wannabe?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Sort of. Nose-jobs smooth their Black edges and try to blend.

Speaker: gordon
Dialogue: You seen this one?

Speaker: coco
Dialogue: Ugh.

Speaker: gordon
Dialogue: Not a fan?

Speaker: mitch
Dialogue: Sup ma?

Speaker: coco
Dialogue: Don't talk like that.

Speaker: gordon
Dialogue: Hey I know you...

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: A Nose-job's worst fear is that their "Blackness" might cause a fuss or draw undue attention so they apologize for it or use it to self deprecate.

Speaker: coco
Dialogue: Forty thousand views already?

Speaker: gordon
Dialogue: Looks like someone submitted you to Buzzfeed. Taking off...

Speaker: mitch
Dialogue: You wan' a drink a sun'in?

Speaker: coco
Dialogue: Let me guess you're from Ohio?

Speaker: mitch
Dialogue: Vermont.

Speaker: gordon
Dialogue: What do you have against Dear White People?

Speaker: sungmi
Dialogue: Okay and One Hundred?

Speaker: reggie
Dialogue: Keeping it One-Hundred! Being Black as hell just cause.

Speaker: sungmi
Dialogue: But what about just being you?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Like I said...

Speaker: annie
Dialogue: You don't mind do you?

Speaker: lionel
Dialogue: Of course not.

Speaker: george
Dialogue: Alright so then what?

Speaker: lionel
Dialogue: So then Sam says "What, is your daddy scared the Negroes are gonna start a rebellion on the plantation?"

Speaker: george
Dialogue: To Kurt Fletcher!?

Speaker: lionel
Dialogue: Yeah. Yes. Yup.

Speaker: george
Dialogue: We've got a news item but there's something bigger here. It's a profile piece on Armstrong / Parker and Sam White's pseudo revolution.

Speaker: annie
Dialogue: What's the headline?

Speaker: lionel
Dialogue: Outdated nationalist seeks purpose starts race war?

Speaker: george
Dialogue: Beers in the corner. Bang out the news item tonight and we'll work on the profile piece for next week.

Speaker: lionel
Dialogue: What are you doing?

Speaker: annie
Dialogue: All Bugle staffer must freestyle. It's law.

Speaker: george
Dialogue: You want to be a staffer right?

Speaker: lionel
Dialogue: My name is Lionel Kind of like a lion King of the jungle Indigenous to Africa...

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: Yo man, you know I wasn't talking about Sof back there with whole forty bitches thing. I was just --

Speaker: kurt
Dialogue: -- trying to get on my staff?

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: I never really thought about --

Speaker: kurt
Dialogue: -- Bullshit. Game Night is where we make our bids for the new staff. It's why everyone's here. You were practically about to bust out a tap dance.

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: I'm a Poly Sci major man. I just came to hang out.

Speaker: kurt
Dialogue: My staff likes you. A lot.

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: But you don't.

Speaker: kurt
Dialogue: This thing with you and Sof...

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: I'm good to her.

Speaker: kurt
Dialogue: Our dad's have been playing a game

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: What and Sof is the White queen?

Speaker: kurt
Dialogue: You're a pawn. And I think it's time you get off the board bro.

Speaker: coco
Dialogue: I just think having good hair and carrying on with a degree of sophistication doesn't make me a traitor to the race.

Speaker: mitch
Dialogue: Want to know why they used to call me Black Mitch?

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: Okay. And what's this year's theme?

Speaker: kurt
Dialogue: Still working on that...

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: The party's a couple weeks away.

Speaker: gordon
Dialogue: Yo Kurt. I want you to meet someone.

Speaker: coco
Dialogue: You guys got a party coming up?

Speaker: sungmi
Dialogue: Hey, about the rally. You could still get the permit anyway Sam and go against the board. Most people consider that political suicide though.

Speaker: reggie
Dialogue: We got to rally Sam. Time is now.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Use your head Reggie. You think a rally is going to change things?

Speaker: reggie
Dialogue: It'll do a hell of a lot more than a radio show or views on Youtube.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: We? I didn't see you running for shit Reggie.

Speaker: reggie
Dialogue: Tired.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Don't "one word" me.

Speaker: reggie
Dialogue: Why you got to snap at me all the time? I'm around you like twenty four seven. Like your lap dog. I don't even usually get down like that with no red bone chicks man.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Don't call me that.

Speaker: reggie
Dialogue: Come on, I thought your ass was Puerto Rican when I met you.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: I'm taking my ass home.

Speaker: reggie
Dialogue: Come on Sam. You know how I feel about you.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: How am I supposed to know how you feel about me?

Speaker: reggie
Dialogue: You know what? Forgive me if I see something in you. Something inspiring. Something folks like me can get behind.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: I'll set up the rally.

Speaker: gordon
Dialogue: Are we sure about this?

Speaker: kurt
Dialogue: It's ironic. Bold. And don't tell me I'm the only one who thinks Sam White's little movement needs to get cut down to size.

Speaker: mitch
Dialogue: `Bout time. It's going to be huge man, fucking epic.

Speaker: kurt
Dialogue: Boys, we've got a lot more mingling to do. We'll be in touch. And Troy? Get off the board bro.

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: Nice seeing you.

Speaker: coco
Dialogue: Where's Sofia?

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: I have no idea.

Speaker: coco
Dialogue: Trouble in paradise?

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: What's that supposed to mean?

Speaker: coco
Dialogue: It's fine. I'm not even really into Black dudes anyway.

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: I'll have you know I'm an equal opportunity employer, okay?

Speaker: coco
Dialogue: And what kind of jobs are you hiring for mister?

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: Aren't you and Sofia --

Speaker: coco
Dialogue: -- I'm an accessory to Sofia. Can't ever shake the feeling I'm an assignment for that Afro Studies Minor of hers.

Speaker: lionel
Dialogue: She seems really cool.

Speaker: george
Dialogue: Did we go too far? You're in Armstrong/Parker right?

Speaker: lionel
Dialogue: No. Garmin.

Speaker: george
Dialogue: Fancy.

Speaker: lionel
Dialogue: George I'm not exactly down with Sam and I'm not in the BSU. I got kicked out of Armstrong / Parker same as Kurt. But I'm going to write a good story, okay?

Speaker: george
Dialogue: I hope so. I want a Bugle on your chest by the end of the month.

Speaker: lionel
Dialogue: I'm growing it out.

Speaker: george
Dialogue: Night Lionel.

Speaker: mitch
Dialogue: Party's not over.

Speaker: lionel
Dialogue: I live here.

Speaker: mitch
Dialogue: Sorry bro. Invitation only.

Speaker: lionel
Dialogue: It's two in the morning.

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: Coco huh?

Speaker: coco
Dialogue: Colandrea doesn't exactly pass the resume test, you know? I mean couldn't you fucking die? My parents should've just named me Ghetto-ass-hoodrat-anisha. Do you...indulge?

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: It's ten am.

Speaker: coco
Dialogue: Sure about that?

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: Sure you don't like Black guys?

Speaker: coco
Dialogue: Girl like me is just a placeholder for ya'll at a place like this.

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: I'm not like that.

Speaker: coco
Dialogue: I don't think Sam would agree.

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: That was different.

Speaker: coco
Dialogue: No it wasn't. Poor thing, she was light skin-ded and everything.

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: Yo, it wasn't like that alright?

Speaker: coco
Dialogue: So your upbringing may have actually fucked you up more than mine? That's hot.

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: Apparently four hundred years of unreconciled oppression.

Speaker: coco
Dialogue: He's not going to like you running with the Pastiche boys is he?

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: If I even get tapped.

Speaker: coco
Dialogue: You will. And you should do it. They all land somewhere big, some before they even graduate. I've seen you in front of a crowd Troy. I bet you could be famous.

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: That what you want? To be famous?

Speaker: coco
Dialogue: I want people to know my name.

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: Which one?

Speaker: coco
Dialogue: Anything?

Speaker: sofia
Dialogue: You said you loved me.

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: I like you a lot.

Speaker: sofia
Dialogue: What do you do in the bathroom? When you leave the shower running? Was it just to get away from me?

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: I smoke weed and write jokes.

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: The hell are you doing?

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: The hell it is.

Speaker: lionel
Dialogue: The Dean said it was the only opening.

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: Head of House doesn't share.

Speaker: lionel
Dialogue: But you're not Head of House.

Speaker: dreads
Dialogue: Stay Black, my brother.

Speaker: lionel
Dialogue: Sure thing?

Speaker: kurt
Dialogue: Need your submission by Thursday.

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: You got it bro.

Speaker: kurt
Dialogue: The fuck?

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: Yo!

Speaker: reggie
Dialogue: Finally made it in.

Speaker: dreads
Dialogue: Been moved around a lot right?

Speaker: curls
Dialogue: You must have been terrified when you saw "Armstrong/Parker" written on your moving assignment.

Speaker: lionel
Dialogue: I was just finishing up.

Speaker: reggie
Dialogue: Do Black people scare you?

Speaker: lionel
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: reggie
Dialogue: You're too scared to even ask anyone for a cut.

Speaker: lionel
Dialogue: I'm growing it out.

Speaker: dreads
Dialogue: No. I'm growing it out. You're fostering an ecosystem.

Speaker: reggie
Dialogue: How come you don't come to BSU?

Speaker: lionel
Dialogue: I listen to Mumford and Sons and watch Robert Altman movies. You honestly think I'm Black enough for the union?

Speaker: dreads
Dialogue: Yo, I love Robert Altman. Mutha fucka goes in.

Speaker: curls
Dialogue: We're not all homophobes you know. Black folks?

Speaker: dreads
Dialogue: I'm bumping Frank Ocean right now. I don't give a fuck. Imma still eat at Chik Fil A though. Them nuggets good as hell.

Speaker: lionel
Dialogue: I'm late for class.

Speaker: reggie
Dialogue: You're the "Black voice" of the Bugle now. We're just trying to decide if you are friend or foe.

Speaker: lionel
Dialogue: I'm not on staff. Not until I make good on my assignment, I'm just --

Speaker: reggie
Dialogue: -- Assignment? What's the story?

Speaker: lionel
Dialogue: They want me to do a profile piece on Black culture at Manchester.

Speaker: reggie
Dialogue: Of which you are so clearly an expert.

Speaker: lionel
Dialogue: Being neither.

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Sam! Really Sam?

Speaker: dean fairbanks
Dialogue: Running late.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Forget your sign Dean?

Speaker: dean fairbanks
Dialogue: Do you honestly think this is in the spirit of Armstrong / Parker house?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: The role of the counter culture is to wake up the mainstream to --

Speaker: dean fairbanks
Dialogue: -- I've got furniture older than you. Counter culture? Is that what you think this is? That show of yours?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: What about my show?

Speaker: dean fairbanks
Dialogue: Your show is racist.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Black people can't be racist.

Speaker: dean fairbanks
Dialogue: Do you read the school papers?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Is the New York Times a school paper?

Speaker: dean fairbanks
Dialogue: Your antics are making press Sam and press like this keeps men like President Fletcher up at night.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Warm milk?

Speaker: dean fairbanks
Dialogue: He's building a file on you.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: It's not my fault your son couldn't beat me in an election.

Speaker: dean fairbanks
Dialogue: I'm sure it was hard growing up. Wondering which side you fit into. Feeling like you have to overcompensate perhaps?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: If that's true, I'm not the only one Dean.

Speaker: reggie
Dialogue: There you are! We supposed to start at noon.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: I told you I had class.

Speaker: reggie
Dialogue: Those are going up on Gillespie. Good right?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: No. I mean how long do I have to talk anyway?

Speaker: reggie
Dialogue: You're kidding right? You're sort of the keynote.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Yeah but...you know I think the whole Malcolm X thing is your lane Reg. I'm just not --

Speaker: reggie
Dialogue: -- They came to hear you Sam. Grab a bullhorn. Turn it on.

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: What is all this?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Hey. In the middle of-- -- Okay. Okay. Okay.

Speaker: reggie
Dialogue: Sam?

Speaker: reggie
Dialogue: Yo, what the hell Sam?

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: You want me to tell them to go?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: You're so tough.

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: I will.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: I want you to wait until they've gone and then head home.

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: I'm trying to be here for you.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Can you be somewhere else for me?

Speaker: reggie
Dialogue: Sam! I know you're home.

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: What do you see in him?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: The only eligible single brother on campus.

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Wow. Okay.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: I get it. Your parents owned in Harlem or something? You watched "Do The Right Thing" in high school and you want to prove to the world you're down?

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: I want to be down? How long does it take to get your hair like that?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Reggie I will call you later damn!  You don't know what you're talking about. Girls like me--

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: --what? Have to pick a side? I'm sick of your tragic Mulatto bullshit Sam!

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: You can't say Mulatto.

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Mulatto! Mulatto! Mulatto!

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Window. Go out the window.

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: I'm sorry if I can't be your Nubian prince on my Black horse ready to take you back to fucking Zamunda!

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: That's not a real African country.

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Can I please get some credit for a solid "Coming to America" reference?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: No? And who am I?

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: You're this...girl...

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Perceptive.

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Who...likes to argue with me about every fucking thing. And I hate it because we both know you're smarter than me. Your favorite director is Bergman, but you tell people its Spike Lee. You love bebop, but you've got a thing for Taylor Swift. I know because my Mac picks up your Mac's library.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: And I was so careful...

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: You like to use phrases from the thirties and wear clothes from the fifties and hairstyles from the sixties. You like to watch me when you think I'm sleeping. And trace the outlines of my face.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Yeah? Yeah? Yeah. It's okay. Get some sleep.

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Everything okay?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: His condition's stable.

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Good. That's good Sam.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Gabe!

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: What!?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: I'm sorry.

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: New videos are picking up steam.

Speaker: coco
Dialogue: Told you I was good TV.

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: The show I'm scouting for... It's called Black Face / White Place. It's reality. Like a "True Life." Each episode centers on a different one of "us" in a sea of "them."

Speaker: coco
Dialogue: Interesting.

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: Interesting? You think they want interesting? Dignified stories of triumph and survival?  They want the "authentic urban experience" which is basically network talk for bitching and weave snatching. I'm telling you this because the network is looking to take one of the subjects to series. I got one episode. One shot to find that subject. So if we do this...

Speaker: coco
Dialogue: ...we do it all the way. I'm guessing Sam turned you down.

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: I think so. She called me a Bojangling Oofta, whatever that means. Everything else she said would've been bleeped on tv.  So look, forty thousand hits on Youtube is good. It's not great.

Speaker: coco
Dialogue: I'm about to get a whole lot more.

Speaker: kurt
Dialogue: We don't have anyone like you on staff and you had a great idea. We brought you here to --

Speaker: coco
Dialogue: -- I want to MC it. Your party.

Speaker: kurt
Dialogue: We're here to tell you what we want.

Speaker: coco
Dialogue: You want me and in order to get me, you have to let me MC.

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: They'd let you do that?

Speaker: coco
Dialogue: They got no choice. They need me --

Speaker: coco
Dialogue: -- cause without me ya'll look like a bunch of privileged assholes.

Speaker: kurt
Dialogue: We don't let people video blog our events...

Speaker: coco
Dialogue: ...You got a week to put this thing together boo boo. What's it going to be?

Speaker: coco
Dialogue: You look surprised.

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: It's just...

Speaker: dean fairbanks
Dialogue: Martin, would you share with Troy what you shared with me?

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: The server that processes the voting results for House Elections has shut down the A.P. database. Saw it this morning. Apparently the intermediary program is on a refractile loop.

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: I'm a Poly Sci major man.

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Sam currently has 445 votes. That's 200 more than she had last week during the actual election.

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: There's not even that many residents in Armstrong / Parker.

Speaker: dean fairbanks
Dialogue: She cheated. Hacked the system.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: I wouldn't even begin to know how to do something like that.

Speaker: president fletcher
Dialogue: Is your little war really this important?

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Had to have been Reggie. Dude's in my programing class. Good. Just forgot to turn his program off.

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: Wow.

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: You're the rightful Head of House.

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: So great.

Speaker: dean fairbanks
Dialogue: Martin, let me talk to Troy for a bit. I appreciate this.

Speaker: president fletcher
Dialogue: Your advisor tells me you're hanging on by a thread in you major. Perhaps it's time to reprioritize.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: You're trying to frighten me, but I think you're the one who's scared.

Speaker: president fletcher
Dialogue: And I think you long for the days where Blacks were hanging from trees and denied actual rights. Then you'd actually have something to fight against.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: You damn right it is.

Speaker: president fletcher
Dialogue: We don't have an intolerance problem here. Except for the one I'm looking at.

Speaker: dean fairbanks
Dialogue: You didn't tell me you and Sofia had a misunderstanding.

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: Who did?

Speaker: dean fairbanks
Dialogue: Her father. She was very upset.  Troy. What sort of vision do you have for yourself?

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: Get my degree. Then Law School and then --

Speaker: dean fairbanks
Dialogue: --And what's that got to do with partying with Kurt? With smoking weed and writing jokes?

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: Dad no. I want what we always talked about. Maybe have my own firm someday? Run for office. Make a difference. Wife. Kids. I want all that. I really really do.

Speaker: dean fairbanks
Dialogue: And the drugs? God damn it Troy I taught you better than this. I have been in academia a long time, I've seen a lot of things. The men who really run this world? You got no idea what they see when they see you. You are not going to be what they all think you are. You will not give them that satisfaction, you hear me?

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: Yes sir.

Speaker: president fletcher
Dialogue: I know about the party. You picked a hell of a time.

Speaker: kurt
Dialogue: What party --

Speaker: president fletcher
Dialogue: -- You're cancelling Kurt. End of story.

Speaker: annie
Dialogue: Well?

Speaker: george
Dialogue: That was our Times advisor. He said it's stories like these that get editors recommendation letters.

Speaker: lionel
Dialogue: The Negro at the door didn't scare you this time.

Speaker: annie
Dialogue: Lionel please. You're only technically Black. G, going to French. You want me to hold your seat?

Speaker: george
Dialogue: Thanks.

Speaker: lionel
Dialogue: You need something? Saw your e- mail.

Speaker: george
Dialogue: Yeah, I need someone to do the Donor's function on Saturday. Small dinner for the school's big givers. Administration wants a little coverage.

Speaker: lionel
Dialogue: That's Halloween night.

Speaker: george
Dialogue: Right, which is why no one else will take it.

Speaker: lionel
Dialogue: Ah. Thus the new guy.

Speaker: george
Dialogue: On my way to class, but you can stay and check out last year's piece. You'll do fine.

Speaker: lionel
Dialogue: I don't know. Are there going to be any racially fueled outbursts at this thing?

Speaker: george
Dialogue: Never know right?

Speaker: lionel
Dialogue: Am I a good writer?

Speaker: george
Dialogue: You'll get better. And we need you right now.

Speaker: lionel
Dialogue: You're just a big recommendation away from landing the Times.

Speaker: george
Dialogue: God I hope so.

Speaker: lionel
Dialogue: Yeah. Sounds good.

Speaker: lionel
Dialogue: Funny seeing you here.

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: Father likes to show me off at all the Donor functions. The dessert course is usually my cue to take a breather while they talk shop.  The trick is to dazzle them into forking over their estates just before they kick the bucket.

Speaker: lionel
Dialogue: So...Picard or Kirk?

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: Kirk. Wait...

Speaker: lionel
Dialogue: I saw you watching Star --

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: -- Yo what happens in the crib stays in the crib. Not trying to get my card revoked.

Speaker: lionel
Dialogue: Hey, some could argue that a show with Whoopi Goldberg, Michael Dorn and Kunta Kinte himself is a pretty Black show.

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: Yeah? That work out for you?

Speaker: lionel
Dialogue: No. No it did not. At least not in High School. I bet there's a statue of you at your High School.

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: I was beloved. Won't lie.

Speaker: lionel
Dialogue: Did they know you were a trekker?

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: My pops left a paint by numbers template for success at that High School. All I had to do was fill in the blanks. Football captain. Valedictorian. Prom King.

Speaker: lionel
Dialogue: I think it's gaining sentience.

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: It's...out there.

Speaker: lionel
Dialogue: It's like a black hole for white people's fingers. They're obsessed.

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: You know I cut hair. Why didn't you ask me?

Speaker: lionel
Dialogue: You're I dunno...you?

Speaker: george
Dialogue: Li! You ready man?

Speaker: lionel
Dialogue: No costumes? I got a tux for this.

Speaker: annie
Dialogue: We just got out of the staff room.

Speaker: george
Dialogue: Yeah, we're going as overworked.

Speaker: lionel
Dialogue: Where is it?

Speaker: annie
Dialogue: Garmin House. On third I think?

Speaker: lionel
Dialogue: Third and Basin. I know it.

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: Yo man. If I'd gone to your High School, I'd have had your back.

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: ...my own firm. Maybe run for office. Make a difference you know?

Speaker: lionel
Dialogue: This is kind of fucked up. Right?

Speaker: george
Dialogue: Pastiche. The world's most erudite boneheads. Who wants another round? Come on Lionel, help a brother out.

Speaker: lionel
Dialogue: Kitchen's this way.

Speaker: coco
Dialogue: Hey there muffins. How do I look? Why are white folks so obsessed with being Black? And why are Black folks so addicted to Blonde Barbie doll weaves? Honeys it's a strange symbiosis we're here to explore...

Speaker: lionel
Dialogue: Ouch.

Speaker: george
Dialogue: Sorry.

Speaker: lionel
Dialogue: It's okay. Can't wait to cut all this off.

Speaker: george
Dialogue: Don't you dare.

Speaker: lionel
Dialogue: I'll be right back.

Speaker: kurt
Dialogue: What the hell?

Dialogue: Okay, I'm fucking confused.

Speaker: lionel

Speaker: lionel

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: If I'm caught being a part of anything like this...it wouldn't be good for me right now okay?

Dialogue: Hey. How's it going. Hi.

Dialogue: Your call then man.

Dialogue: Alright ya'll - thanks for coming out tonight. Looks like Sam's not making it so...let's just call it.

Dialogue: Uh. Excuse me. Hi. I'm Lionel. Some of you...none of you probably know me. I've never been to a meeting. But I just came back from a party on campus and I think you should know about it.

Speaker: reggie
Dialogue: Alright brother. What's the plan?

Speaker: lionel
Dialogue: We go over there. Now.

Speaker: curls
Dialogue: Think there's enough of us?

Speaker: sungmi
Dialogue: You know you don't have a monopoly on being a pissed off minority. Latino's United is meeting across the hall. Asian American League too.  You guys got better snacks.

Dialogue: Dad...

Speaker: dean fairbanks
Dialogue: Not now Troy.

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: It's important. There's something happening on campus. I might've...

Speaker: dean fairbanks
Dialogue: You're being rude son.

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: Oh am I? How about I tell your precious donors and anyone here who'll listen about the kind of a school it is they're giving to?

Speaker: dean fairbanks
Dialogue: I don't know who you think you are young man but you don't get to talk to your father any kind of way.

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: All I say to you is yes sir and no sir! Look I should've brought this up before but --  -- listen to me!

Dialogue: What?

Dialogue: Yeah dude. We all got it. I mean, everything's cool right?

Dialogue: Fuck you I'm calling the cops.

Dialogue: Gimme that mic Before I slap ya Looking for some dykes, that wanna another chapta. If you do me slow, you can do me faster, I'll pass you to the Nigga on my right, he gets you after.

Speaker: lionel
Dialogue: Kurt--

Speaker: kurt
Dialogue: -- Why don't you tuck your tail between your legs, run and tell the Dean and get the fuck out.

Speaker: lionel
Dialogue: Heyyyy! Hoooo! Heyyy! Hooo!

Speaker: coco
Dialogue: What? Say it. Come on.

Speaker: kurt
Dialogue: Dude. I know you can't help it...

Speaker: lionel
Dialogue: Finally got me where you want me.

Speaker: dean fairbanks
Dialogue: What is all this?

Speaker: kurt
Dialogue: I didn't do this. Sam. I had nothing to do with this.

Speaker: anchor
Dialogue: What some are calling a "race war" has erupted at one of the nation's oldest and most prestigious --

Speaker: dean fairbanks
Dialogue: We don't condone this egregious event and are investigating its origins. The president and I are looking at ways to address issues of Diversity at Manchester.

Speaker: reggie
Dialogue: HOUSING REFORM!

Speaker: mitch
Dialogue: I'm sorry but it's bullshit. Yo this is how we get down. If you can't take a joke in this day and age? The fact we can joke about it proves we've moved on you feel me? This is an attack on free speech! We're the victims here!

Speaker: lionel
Dialogue: It's hard enough for us to even get into a school like this. Let alone succeed. Find our way. This is only a debate because of who Kurt's dad is, which just proves the point. All you did was have a radio show and look what happened to you.

Speaker: coco
Dialogue: I know this may come as a shock, but nobody gives a fuck about no Harriet muthafuckin Tubman...they wanna be us. So they got to be for a night.

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: Of course I got my dad involved. It was the right thing to do. I didn't mean for all this to happen. All the posters and everything.

Speaker: troy
Dialogue: I think...I'd make more than few people happy if I ran.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Dear White People...

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: ...Know what? Nevermind.

Dialogue: Once I heard what the group was planning, I sent out an email to the staff to cancel it. You have the email printed in front of you.

Dialogue: Who's this?

Speaker: kurt
Dialogue: My lawyer.

Speaker: coco
Dialogue: So when I got the invite and saw everyone clicking "yes" I figured it was back on.

Dialogue: You were hoping to make the staff?

Dialogue: At what point in time did you show up to the event?

Dialogue: Why am I even here?

Dialogue: 94              Guys throw parties at the house all               94 the time.

Dialogue: We know you were planning this.

Dialogue: Your son tell you that?

Dialogue: No. Mine wasn't chosen.

Dialogue: But you wanted to be?

Dialogue: What I wanted didn't matter then. Why should it matter now? I told you about the party, remember?

Dialogue: 94              The invite came from the Pastiche               94 Facebook account.

Dialogue: I loathe Facebook.

Speaker: dean fairbanks
Dialogue: You've used that line on me before this year Mr. Fletcher. When a homophobic message mysteriously appeared on a voice mail line you shared with a roommate.

Speaker: lionel
Dialogue: To stop it.

Speaker: dean fairbanks
Dialogue: By any means necessary?

Speaker: lionel
Dialogue: Someone once told me...Manchester is like jazz. I don't know much about jazz. But from what I can tell, when your solo's up, you better blow.

Dialogue: Well what's interesting is how easy it was to access the group before the note was sent. The password was "Pa$tiche" spelled with a dollar sign according to Kurt. Seems recently it's been changed.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: As much as you hate him, you will stop at nothing to protect your master and his boy.

Dialogue: Did you send out the invite Sam?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: That invite, whoever sent it should've been met with derision and outrage. Instead, a hundred people showed up and they pulled out posters and decorations and costumes they'd made for just such an occasion.

Speaker: lionel
Dialogue: 2 Chainz? Shaft? While endless complex depictions of whites, white men in particular exist - there aren't that many versions of us in the culture.

Dialogue: Next James Baldwin up in here. Wait hold on a sec.

Dialogue: Hello Sam.

Dialogue: Yeah. Prez made an executive withdrawal. Armstrong stays Black.

Dialogue: Congrats?

Dialogue: Getting too dramatic man. Thinking about getting an apartment off campus. We'll see.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: He's recovering.

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Good. Well...

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: We were actually on the phone last night for hours. First time we talked since the bypass. He was putting up a strong front. Teasing me about being so worried. Then came the stories about me as a little girl I'd heard a thousand times. About how independent I was.

Speaker: gabe
Dialogue: Want to talk about it?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: My mother worked nights so he would take me to school. And it pissed me off because he would follow me all the way to homeroom. Every time he tried to hold my hand I'd scream and pull away. He thought I was just being...difficult.

Dialogue: I'm sure he forgives you.
